intro: Galium brasiliense, commonly known as Brazilian bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and it has a weak, twining growth habit. Galium brasiliense is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
